thread.title: A Tough Start for U.S. Women at the Australian Open

author: Tom Perrotta
title: A Tough Start for U.S. Women at the Australian Open
text:
At the U.S. Open last year, four American women reached the semifinals, a rare achievement by a single nation in tennis. But at the Australian Open, theyâ€™re closing in on a different kind of sweep: first-round upsets.
In Melbourne on Monday three of the four highest-ranked American women went down to unseeded players. Sloane Stephens, the U.S. Open champion, lost her eighth consecutive match, this time to Zhang Shuai 2-6, 7-6(2), 6-2. Venus Williams was beaten by Belinda Bencic, a 20-year-old former top-10 pro who is recovering...
